column5: Slowpoke.. it was great to see ya.. glad ya had a good time... The G2G's help put everyone and everything (including the goats) into perspective.
Slowpoke,was nice meeting you...Big Guy.. and thanks for the report.Seeyou next year.  Steve
Awesome Report! Great capture of the moment blow by blow with the supporting pics!
Sorry Slowpoke ... that water front property is not for sale.  Kinda looks like Dog's house in 'bama.
Great report and pics Brian .The pics alone make me want to go next year .I will clean if you cook.Nice boat looks like a sold vessel for the great lakes.That's it I have to go next year.MTP

Brian...it was great finally getting to meet you!!  Your report had me laughing all the way through...just like while I was up there chatting with all the other OFNers.  Hope to see you up there again next year....bly and I will be there for sure...hopefully for more than just a few days too.

Just wanted to let you all know that the G2G at Lakair went as scheduled and turned out to be possibly one of our best ever. Great times had by all with a bonus shore lunch fish fry on Tombstone Island in West Bay put on by our host kevin Cameron otherwise known as Captain Hooked and yours truly Muskiestudd Friday afternoon.  We had a great turn out at the pike derby and incredibly enough Rick Obanion took the trophy and a Garmin GPS with most accumilated inches in total and myself taking the big fish of the day which rewarded me with Speils donation which was a Minn Kotta electric trolling motor  ..... There were many other prizes handed out and a Lakair trip raffled off as well....... Soooooo,I would like to invite all who were involved to chime in with there pictures and stories of the G2G event...This should be good......

Yep what happens at Lakair stays at ....well you know  LOL "crack of 10am" heck Lew already had a 1/2 day of fishing in by then!  Good report! would say glad you had a great time but one can't help not too!  Whopper
Wow    Congrats Rick and Chris!  Go ahead rub it in!  Whopper
what a blast... boy that food is getting me hungry....  you really make people that didn't go, wish they had went!
MS, nice to see you again! I kinda forgot just how good of a guy you are.. had a blast shooting the carp with yah  Seeya next year!  And congrats guys!  Gerritt.
Hey Gerrit,back at ya bro Was nice finally hookin up with ya bud......
That was a great read..Thanks for taking the time to put it together..Looks like a great time.
thanks for a great report,,,wish i coulda been there!!!
Thanks for a great report!     Any musky caught while you were there? I've been up a coupla times and keep hoping someone during the June OFC weekend will actually catch one!
great report!  looks like a fun time!  Cheers!
thanks for sharing a great report and all the pics!
Great read!  Thanks for sharing all the stories.
sounds like everyone had a blast

Great report,thanks for sharing.Wish I could have made it but I'm sure it won't be the last.This year was just not meant to be for me,but rest assured I shall return.I'd like to give a shout out to everyone I missed and look forward to the future G2Gs.  Brian
Great read Brian. Thanks
Hey Gerrit it was great to have met you i had a blast at Lakair, and dont forget to get that pedistal seat for your boat Cheers !!!  Mike
Great report Brian, and it was great to finally meet you.  Glad you had such a good time, I hope to see you again next year.  Maureen

Excellent report and pics Brian!!    Thanks for sharing.  I'm happier then a pig in %$@& with all these excellent lakair reports.  I'm looking forward to Lakair 2008 already.  This kid is gonna be there or be square.  Cheers  FOTB

Thanks everyone for the kind remarks and taking the time to post them. It was my first Lakair trip and certainly not my last. In fact, I might do it again this year. If you've never been you owe it to yourself to go. We had outstanding weather all week but even if it rained, I would have enjoyed my stay just as much.  Most rewarding was the one-on-one conversations. There were too many too mention without leaving somebody out but I learned a lot about life, fishing and way more than I needed to know about Alabama goats.  There was indeed a muskie caught but I'll leave it up them to post a report.  -Brian
Cool report!  I especially like the documented shore lunch action.  Corn Nug
great report and photo essay, thanks for sharing  John
Oh  man am I ever missing out. One of these days....one of these days!  Great read. Next best thing to being there. Thanks for sharing.
Great report!
Beauty report, makes me want to trade-in my coffee for a beer...
